[משתמש עשה ריטוויט]
"Your source of information is ChatGPT. Lol. 

Its chain of narration is weak and cannot be used as evidence, and Mālik al-Dār is unknown.

As for the statement of Ibn Hajar  in al-Fatḥ:
Reported by Ibn Abī Shaybah with a sound chain from Abū Ṣāliḥ al-Sammān from Mālik al-Dār.

his intent is that the chain is sound up to Abū Ṣāliḥ only; he did not judge the entire chain to be sound.

Ibn Ḥajar also reported that Sayf narrated in al-Futūḥ that the one who saw the dream was the Companion Bilāl al-Muzanī. However, Sayf is Ibn ʿUmar al-Tamīmī al-Ḍabbī, one of the weak and abandoned narrators, as stated by al-Ḥāfiẓ Ibn Ḥajar in al-Taqrīb."

📍| Thread: Maliki Madhab on leaving Actions: 

❋ Abū Muṣʿab al-Zuhrī al Mālikī said, Ḥabīb Said:

"Īmān is speech (qawl) and action (ʿamal); it increases and decreases. Whoever says otherwise is a kāfir."

Tartīb al-Madārik (3/348).

❋ ʾAbū Jaʿfar aṭ-Ṭaḥāwī Said:

Some of the ḥuffāẓ said regarding the statement of Mālik that it is from Mālik’s madhab that whoever deliberately abandons a prayer without an excuse until its time has passed is an Murtad and is to be killed.

Ikhtilāf al-ʿUlamāʾ (p. 2073)

❋ I [ʾAbū ʿĪsā at-Tirmidhi] heard Abū Muṣʿab al-Madanī saying:
“Whoever says, ‘Īmān is [only] speech,’ is to be asked to repent; if he repents, then [fine], otherwise I would strike his neck.”

‘‘And this is likewise the view expressed to me by those among Mālik’s companions whom I consulted regarding the matter in its entirety.’”  

Al Muntaqā fī Sharḥ al-Muwaṭṭaʾ (3/111)

❋ Ibn Baṭṭah al-ʿUkbarī:

Sahl ibn ʿAbd Allāh at-Tustarī was asked about īmān, what is it? He said: “It is qawl (speech), nīyah (intention), ʿamal (action), and Sunnah.

For īmān, if it is saying (qawl) without Action (ʿamal), it would be kufr,

and if it is saying (qawl) and

❋ ʿAbd al-Malik ibn Ḥabīb (174-238):  

“The slaughter of one who abandons prayer is not to be eaten, nor the slaughter of one who neglects it and is known for being careless with it, and he (Mālik) indicated thereby that this amounts to irtidād (Apostasy). He said:

actions (ʿamal) without Intention (nīyah), it is nifāq, and if it is saying (qawl), actions (ʿamal), and intention (nīyah) without Sunnah, it is bidʿah.”

 al-Ibānah al-Kubrā (2/813).
